thread.title: Bihar polls: EC chastise Lalu for allegedly violating model code of conduct
thread.title_full: Bihar polls: EC chastise Lalu for allegedly violating model code of conduct - Livemint

author: Anuja
title: Bihar polls: EC chastise Lalu for allegedly violating model code of conduct
text:
New Delhi : The Election Commission on Thursday chastised Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad for an alleged violation of the model code of conduct which is in force in the assembly elections in Bihar.
Prasad was warned for making an allegedly casteist comments on 1 October in Terasia village of Raghopur constituency. Prasad is alleged to have said that the Bihar elections were a direct fight between “the backward castes and forward castes”. 
EC had asked Prasad to respond as to why no action should be taken against him but was unsatisfied with his explanation. An FIR has already been lodged against Prasad for his remarks.
“The Commission has considered your reply carefully and has observed that you have not denied having made the impugned statements...the explanations furnished by you in support of justifying those statements have not been found convincing by the Commission,” the EC said in its order on Thursday adding that such statements could aggravate differences between sections of society.
However, Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar defended Lalu Prasad. “According to me in this election, it was BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party) who started using derogatory language,” Kumar tweeted.
